name: ParadeDB
headline: Postgres for Search and Analytics
description: ParadeDB is an Elasticsearch alternative built on Postgres. We're modernizing the features of Elasticsearch's product suite, starting with real-time search and analytics.
tags: industry:developer-tools; industry:analytics; industry:open-source; industry:infrastructure; industry:databases; location:new-york

founders.name: Philippe Noël, Founder
founders.description: Founder & CEO @ ParadeDB. Previously @Whist, @Microsoft. Harvard CS'20. From Québec.

markdown:
raw_markdown="Case Study
Alibaba brings full text search to its data warehouse with ParadeDB. [Read their story.](https://paradedb.com/</blog/case_study_alibaba>)
[Company logo](https://paradedb.com/</>)
[Blog](https://paradedb.com/</blog>)[Documentation](https://paradedb.com/<https:/docs.paradedb.com>)[Community](https://paradedb.com/<https:/join.slack.com/t/paradedbcommunity/shared_invite/zt-2lkzdsetw-OiIgbyFeiibd1DG~6wFgTQ>)
[0](https://paradedb.com/<https:/github.com/paradedb/paradedb>)[Book a Demo](https://paradedb.com/<https:/calendly.com/paradedb>)
  * [Documentation](https://paradedb.com/<https:/docs.paradedb.com>)
  * [Blog](https://paradedb.com/</blog>)
  * [Changelog](https://paradedb.com/<https:/docs.paradedb.com/changelog>)


[Announcing our partnership with Ubicloud](https://paradedb.com/<https:/www.ubicloud.com/blog/elastic-quality-full-text-search-on-postgres>)
# Search and analytics for Postgres with zero ETL
ParadeDB is a modern Elasticsearch alternative built on Postgres. Built for real-time, update-heavy workloads.
[Book a Demo](https://paradedb.com/<https:/calendly.com/paradedb>)[Documentation](https://paradedb.com/<https:/docs.paradedb.com>)
```
docker run --name paradedb -e POSTGRES_PASSWORD=password paradedb/paradedb
docker exec -it paradedb psql -U postgres
```

Trusted by enterprises, loved by developers
Product
## Make Postgres aspowerful as Elastic
By transforming Postgres into a performant search and analytics engine, ParadeDB frees your team from the pain of scaling and syncing Elasticsearch.
Search
Supercharge Postgres' search capabilities with BM25 scoring, custom tokenizers, hybrid search, and more. 
[Read Docs](https://paradedb.com/<https:/docs.paradedb.com/documentation/full-text/overview>)
Analytics
Enrich your search results with support for fast analytics and faceting.
[Read Docs](https://paradedb.com/<https:/docs.paradedb.com/documentation/faceting/overview>)
Benefits
## Simplify and strengthen your data stack
Reduced overhead
    Eliminate complex sync tools like ETL, Kafka, and Debezium. With ParadeDB, you can just use Postgres.
Zero data loss
    Never lose data again because of a broken sync with Elastic. ParadeDB uses native Postgres indexes that always stay up to date.
ACID guarantees
    Postgres ACID transactions guarantee that data is searchable immediately after a successful write.
Automatic cleanup
    Never worry about cleaning up stale Elastic indexes. ParadeDB search indexes integrate with Postgres' vacuum process.
Reliable data store
    First class support for backups, high availability and disaster recovery through Postgres.
Postgres dialect
    Write queries using Postgres SQL. No need to wrangle with an unfamiliar query language.
Zero ETL
## Integrates with yourexisting infra
ParadeDB integrates with managed Postgres services and data lakes using native Postgres replication and APIs. Zero ETL required.
![rds](https://paradedb.com/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Frds.67e16470.png&w=3840&q=75)
RDS Compatible
ParadeDB uses logical replication to consume data from Amazon RDS, Azure Postgres and Google Cloud SQL.
[Read Docs](https://paradedb.com/<https:/docs.paradedb.com/deploy/replication>)
![datalake](https://paradedb.com/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fs3.31d1aa90.png&w=3840&q=75)
S3 Compatible
ParadeDB can directly query and ingest data from S3, GCS, and Azure Blob Storage.
[Read Docs](https://paradedb.com/<https:/docs.paradedb.com/integrations/overview>)
Open Source
## Trusted by the community
ParadeDB has been deployed across thousands of production environments on multi-TB clusters.
50K+
Docker deployments
    Our Docker image is the easiest way to test or self-manage ParadeDB.
[Run Docker image](https://paradedb.com/<https:/docs.paradedb.com/deploy/self-hosted/docker>)
15K+
Postgres extension installs
    All our features are shipped as Postgres extensions, which means that ParadeDB can drop into any self-managed Postgres.
[Install extensions](https://paradedb.com/<https:/docs.paradedb.com/deploy/self-hosted/extensions>)
6K+
Stargazers on Github
    ParadeDB is one of the fastest-growing open source database projects.
[Star ParadeDB](https://paradedb.com/<https:/github.com/paradedb/paradedb>)
### Ready to get started?
Start testing right away with our [docs](https://paradedb.com/<https:/docs.paradedb.com>) or book a demo with our sales team.
Email addressBook Demo
Have a question? Email us
[](https://paradedb.com/</>)
Zero-ETL search and analytics for Postgres.Built in New York, made for the world.

generated_description:
**ParadeDB: Postgres for Search and Analytics**

Founded in 2023 and emerging from Y Combinator's Batch S23, ParadeDB is making waves from its base in New York. It positions itself as a cutting-edge alternative to Elasticsearch, built on the robust infrastructure of PostgreSQL. Their mission? To harness the power of Postgres for enhanced search capabilities and real-time analytics, eliminating the complex overhead that often bogs down developers.

**What’s the Big Idea?**

At its core, ParadeDB aims to transform Postgres into a powerful search engine. It’s designed especially for real-time, update-heavy workloads, enabling teams to bypass the cumbersome synchronization tools typically associated with Elasticsearch. By leveraging the native strengths of Postgres, ParadeDB brings features like BM25 scoring, custom tokenizers, and hybrid search to the table, ensuring that developers can supercharge their data without the headaches of managing multiple systems.

**Key Features:**
- **Zero ETL:** Easily integrate with your existing infrastructure using native Postgres replication—no messy ETL processes required.
- **ACID Compliance:** Ensures your data is always searchable right after writing, thanks to Postgres’ transactional guarantees.
- **Automatic Cleanup:** No more worries about stale indexes; ParadeDB keeps everything tidy with Postgres’ vacuum process.
- **Open Source:** Trusted by a growing community, ParadeDB has already seen significant Docker deployments and Postgres extension installs.

**Community and Support**

ParadeDB is more than just a product; it’s a growing community. The company supports its users with rich documentation, a blog, and dedicated channels for feedback and collaboration. Their product has gained trust among enterprises while being loved by developers for its simplicity and effectiveness.

Whether you're part of a startup or a large organization, ParadeDB's focus on integrating seamlessly with managed Postgres services speaks volumes about its practicality. Notably, it supports data ingestion from various sources like Amazon RDS, Azure PostgreSQL, and Google Cloud SQL.

**In Summary**

ParadeDB is driving a paradigm shift in the way we think about search and analytics in the context of Postgres. With a talented team of four and strong backing from Y Combinator, they're poised for significant impact. If you’re eager to explore its capabilities, you can start with their [documentation](https://paradedb.com/docs.paradedb.com) or even book a demo to see it in action.

To follow their journey, connect on [GitHub](https://github.com/paradedb/paradedb), or join their [Slack community](https://join.slack.com/t/paradedbcommunity/shared_invite/zt-2lkzdsetw-OiIgbyFeiibd1DG~6wFgTQ). 

In a world where efficient data handling is crucial, ParadeDB is carving a niche that many will find hard to ignore.
